p: It became clear in the analysis process that participants expressed strong feelings about being able to make a choice for treatment delivery site (mode). For many, the basic idea of being offered a choice, and then being given the opportunity to choose for themselves, reflected a new kind of thinking. Drawn from a field note regarding the value of nurses and their connection to participants, there was a recognized sentiment among some participants that being offered a choice showed that the nurses cared. Consequently, many of the responses support the notion that choice led to feelings of empowerment and feeling connected with clinic staff.
